alert.note: Alert for Broadwater; Central and Southern Lewis and Clark; Southern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 5:56PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Lewis and Clark, northern Broadwater, northeastern Jefferson, and southwestern Teton Counties through 630 PM MDT... At 554 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 25 miles west of Augusta to near Helena. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Helena, Lincoln, East Helena, Augusta, Montana City, Wolf Creek, York, Rimini, Alhambra, Spring Meadow Lake State Park, Austin, Nilan Reservoir, Bean Lake, Bowmans Corner, Marysville, Winston, Craig, Clancy, Canyon Creek and Black Sandy State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 181 and 243. Highway 200 between mile markers 66 and 116. Highway 12 between mile markers 28 and 68. Highway 287 between mile markers 1 and 50. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall may also lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
